title: Ptomsoouwé Batchassi
text:
Ptomsoouwé Batchassi (born 1958) is a <a href="Togo">Togo</a>lese politician and a member of the <a href="Pan-African%20Parliament">Pan-African Parliament</a> from Togo.
Batchassi was born in <a href="Kazaboua">Kazaboua</a>, <a href="Sotouboua">Sotouboua Prefecture</a>. He was administrative secretary of the regional bureau of the <a href="Rally%20of%20the%20Togolese%20People">Rally of the Togolese People</a> (RPT) in Sotouboua Prefecture from 1992 to 1994. He was subsequently prefectoral secretary of the RPT in Sotouboua Prefecture from 1997 to 2001 and was elected to the <a href="National%20Assembly%20of%20Togo">National Assembly of Togo</a> in the <a href="1999%20Togolese%20parliamentary%20election">March 1999 parliamentary election</a>, becoming a member of the National Assembly's Social and Cultural Committee. He was re-elected in the <a href="2002%20Togolese%20parliamentary%20election">October 2002 parliamentary election</a> from the Second Constituency of Sotouboua Prefecture and became Second Questeur of the National Assembly.
On February 3, 2004 he was elected to the Pan-African Parliament; he was re-elected to the Pan-African Parliament in 2005.
Batchassi is a member of the RPT Central Committee from Sotouboua Prefecture as of the RPT's Ninth Ordinary Congress in December 2006.
